instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not seeing the battery
threads.message: Hi ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with liquid damage, at first board would not turn on , thats all sorted then there was no audio and thats sorted but now its not seeing the battery, at <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> i get 3.4v each side and <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> i get 3.4v pin 1 and 135ma pin 2, <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> measured 1.9k but changed anyway and still measure 1.9k , ive removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and measurements still stay the same , am i right in thinking its got to be the smc, i have relowed it and its no different, i have tried the battery in another mac and its working fine , just thought i would ask before changing smc in case im missing something else, i have also removed j6955 for good measure :-)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not seeing the battery
threads.message:
The data lines are the same for BIL, battery connector and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and all goes to SMC.......

Unplug BIL, check for corrosion on bill connector, battery connector and <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>, if everything is ok SMC is bad....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not seeing the battery
threads.message: If the ISL isnâ€™t bringing the voltage up, then check the caps on the back of the board to see if they look bad. If not, then you have to replace the SMC

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not seeing the battery
threads.message: ok thanks , looks like its the smc, does anyone know of any UK suppliers where i can get the stensil from or an smc, had this laptop for a couple of weeks now and dont really want to order from overseas

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not seeing the battery
threads.message: Just a quick follow up , replaced smc and all is fine
